intro: Eriosyce ceratistes var. coquimbensis, commonly known as the Coquimbo eriosyce, is a species of flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family. This plant is characterized by its compact, globular shape and its ability to store water in its thick, fleshy stems. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by edible, spherical fruits. The plant is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal regions with sandy soils.
